pros: Pay is pretty great. Would recommend
cons: Benefits are not as good as other chc's

review_title: Be sure to have a Plan B
pros: Since it's a Community Health Center, it's a great way to gain experience/hours, especially for Medical and Dental Assistants (if you can deal with Cons below). The mission of the organization is positive and benefits society.
cons: So many aspects of the organization are about 20 years behind everyone else. This goes for computer/network, EHR, policy and practices. Ooooozing with toxicity in almost every corner. Sometimes it takes a while to see it and recognize it, while other times it's extremely obvious how toxic of a work environment this can be (especially at the Admin campus). Despite their attempts at looking like they have a competitive compensation package, it is one of the lowest paying jobs I've had (in my field with my level of experience). You have to make a business case for anything that you need (or that might help) with your job. It doesn't matter how expensive the item/need is, you still have to make a formal business case, wait several months and then get told no. Several months was too long for me. Leaving ASAP.

pros: Holiday Pay was great and time and half.
cons: Convinvg, micro managing from every end, they go through your computer history, which is weird.

job_title: Physician, Family Practice in Renton, WA
pros: Under-served patients, access to PSLF Relatively up to date facilities Access to support services
cons: NextGen and aging IT infrastructure Pay is set when you start based on experience and will continue with you for the time you are with the company, only small increases over time that do not keep up with inflation

review_title: Supervisor was the worst and lacked leadership. She did not like Black people.

cons: The most racist place I ever work The supervisor was very cozy with the ED that left and with that incompetence is now the executive director. The Peter principle in action. Incompetent people always get promoted.

review_title: Work at HealthPoint, mission driven organization that is effective and a leader
job_title: Primary Care Physician in Kent, WA
pros: I have worked at HealthPoint for 20 years and I love it. I'd never work anywhere else. The executive leadership team is outstanding and I trust them to make great decisions and lead the organization into the future. They care deeply about their employees and their patients and don't neglect one for the other. They are organized and effective and that's hard to find in the non for profit world. Plus they believe strongly in antiracism work and integrative medicine with naturopaths and acupuncturists.
cons: none that I can think of

pros:
Team work
Responsive Senior Leadership team
cons: Need more opportunity to grow

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Renton, WA

cons: burn out in the call center

pros: Culture fit and diversity desired organization that supports creativity, ingenuity, efficiency, and productivity-based compensation. Continuous improvement encouragement and adult learning. Community Focused Partnerships and valued family / work life balance
cons: Finding and retaining staff, supporting clinics that are short-staffed. The nature of being short-staffed creates a burden on existing teams; which is more of external threats that affect recruitment, pandemic variants create challenges to providing patient care.

review_title: Non profit  doing the work in our communities

pros: no day is the same. You get to think outside the box. I work with Kind hearted people.
cons: Finding additional resources outside of our clinics can be difficult. Patient often need more than we can provide.

pros: - you get to make a meaningful difference in people's life.
cons: Management is terrible. Toxic work place. I often would cry about how bad it was

review_title: Don't work here unless you know someone.
pros: Benefits were varied and easy to use. Pay came on time which is always wanted, and the paid days off were very easy to use.
cons: Management plays favorites, and complaints filed about someone who is a favorite go without any real consequences. I know this because I was one of those. I got the job because of someone I know  in management, and kept it because of someone I know. After not completing 100% of the work that was required of me, for about a week straight I caused an issue to come up with another employee since I controlled how her schedule and schedule patients as well. After the incident she was fired. I felt horrible, I went to my department manager and she told me that it was fine things happen. I couldn't believe it, someone got fired because I was too comfortable with being lazy at work!! Soon after I began to get complaints filed about me to HR. After 3 I had to sit down with my manager and depadepartment head. Both told me that I didn't need to worry about being fired just try to work harder and to "let them know ahead of time if someone like this happens so they can make it go away". It blew mind that I could be so irresponsible and cost someone there job get complaints filed and still have nothing happen to me.

pros: None, substandard processes led by incompetent manager.
cons: Complaints to HR result in retaliation against victims and increased pay and the promotion of the perpetrator.

review_title: Good for community, bad for employees.
pros:
It was close to home. 
Job came just as my unemployment ran out. 
Plenty of parking. 
Some coworkers could be trusted. 
Paycheck.
cons:
If you were a few minutes late - even as salary - it would go in your record. 
DON'T think you can email if you are late, in traffic, need a sick day - you must always CALL and talk to someone - or get written up. 
Other coworkers  moved up the corporate ladder with hard-core brown nosing.  They would even start scheduling your lunches, rather than your own manager.   
Micromanagement. 
Other coworkers would Cc: the entire department when you made a mistake. This included all managers above you, even for a small thing. 
Don't make mistakes!
As others have said, there is a very high turnover.  20+ a month.  When they don't want you, you'll get about 10 minutes notice before you are out the door with your cardboard box. 
Not compassionate about personal issues.  I had a death in my family and I emailed several times that I would need a day off.  I got busted - why?  Because I didn't CALL a manager.   
They added Saturday work on a rotating basis.  Salary people would even be treated like hourly and have to make up hours during the week. 
Weekly meetings way too long.

review_title: Care about the community and stands by their mission statement
pros: Strong commitment to their mission statement and helping the uninsured and low poverty community. They make you want to get out and really take a stand with all the healthcare hooplah that's going around today. They care about their patients and the quality of care they are providing. Depending on who your manager is, there can be great communication and respect.
cons: Sometimes the lack of communication plays a big toll on departments. Favorism is sometimes an issue. Some managers are more laid back than others. Rules are different for some employees than others. Not treated fairly among everyone. PTO is sometimes an issue for some depts and making up time.

review_title: UPPER EXECUTIVE ADMINISTRATORS BULLIES, BACK STABBERS,  LIARS, POWER MONGERS
pros: Like any large corporation, benefits are accessible and varied. Many opportunities exist within the company.  Many Site Offices.
cons: Although executive management receives advanced management training, their leadership style has not improved but has become worse than before!  They treat their providers  with little respect, often parading their failures and mistakes throughout the company.  More often than before, Providers are treated like assembly line workers. The executive team micro-manage and selectively listen to only those they favor, instead of the entire site team.  Although surveys are distributed to all team members, information gathered is not used.  Decisions to promote or not hire a candidate are based on personality traits instead of qualifications. Other routine operations include Frequent Closed door secret meetings with just 2 leaders and consulting with unpopular team members to promote spying and surveillance on employees who do not conform.  It's become a company of BULLIES .

review_title: Great Place for Mission & Quality-Driven People
pros:
-Inspiring, passionate co-workers
-Flexibility in work schedule (at Admin)
-Competent and caring top leadership
-Open to new ideas, always looking to improve (LEAN organization)
- Willing to pioneer new ideas
-You feel GOOD about the work you do because it makes a difference in people's lives.
-Get to learn about other cultures and people in your community.
cons:
-In the long term this will be a pro, but right now they're going through a lot of change which can be unsettling.
-Still kind old school in their HR department with things like dress code.
-No bike parking or showers at Admin
- I wish they'd spend more on compensation for front-line positions like MAs and nurses.

review_title: HR does not have a HR Professional
pros: It is a good place to get your experience and then get out...
cons: Supervisors need to learn how to lead and have successful teams.  It is clear they lack training in supervisory skills. Get down to the basics, stop micromanaging (the COO must encourage micromanaging). Your employees' success is based upon how the management and supervisors coach them. In fact, there is no positive coaching what-so-ever.

pros: HealthPoint really cares about their patients. I have never seen anything like it before. They try to offer good benifits for a CHC. The CEO is very humble and nice to be around. Good training, and they encourage people moving up within the company.
cons: No matter how hard you work it's never enough. Front desk is the first to blame for any issues regardless of the situation. The work load is outrageous and keeps growing.

pros: Strong commitment to the low income, under insured or uninsured patients. All services bundled in one place.
cons: Lack of communication. Micromanagement of employees. Lack of interpersonal skills from management to employees. Job advancement is so hard due to favoritism. High turnover rates. Overworked and underpaid employees.

pros: The leadership is very dedicated to its mission. Hard-working, caring team based work environment. If you are mission-driven, this is a great place to work. Very rewarding.  Experienced, supportive management.
cons: Everyone is pushed to work at the top of their skill level. You will work hard here! But I think it's worth it. I wish the salaries for MAs were higher. I think this is being worked on. There is currently a lot of MA turnover.

review_title: Great mission and vission to help communities.  Need to clean up management.
job_title: Quality Improvement Coordinator in Renton, WA
pros: Beautiful mission and great vision that unfortunately is not achievable with some of current management.  Its starting to improve with some outsiders that are starting to come in but executives need to clean house and evaluate other EDUCATED staff members that are being suppressed by the system.
cons: Management not qualified and chosen by buddy system rather than skills and talent.

pros: Some good, kind, hard working coworkers. Nothing else I can think of. Maybe one hour lunchtime once in a while.
cons:
Bad management. Disorganization. No respect from managers. ( however, can be different from clinic to clinic)

I have seen so many coworkers tears at work. We are not children. You are not a principal. As a manager or supervisor, you don’t call out employee from their position in front of patients or coworkers then point out at them. Everyone can see their face, tears and discouragement. Leaderships are not confident how to deal with their staff, continue to present immature management skills, manipulate all relationships between each personals.

job_title: Patient Account Representative in Renton, WA
pros: Good place to start out with little or no experience..
cons: Supervisors in the billing department have poor communication skills with there Subordinates. They also encouraged staff to be competitive and promoted backstabbing to get ahead. One particular manager used fake Write ups to make me feel like I was in hot water, only to find out from HR that they weren’t even filed or real it was just a ploy to keep me buckled down and highly productive.

pros: In order: the mission, having an opportunity to serve the community, and the friends you make while working here.
cons:
Admin leadership is incredibly disconnected and is truly limited in their ability to lead people. The higher up people are, the more disconnected they seem to be with what’s actually going on in the clinic. On Executive Leader works one day in the clinic... this does not mean “she’s plugged in”. It requires far more than a few meetings and a day or so in a clinic. 

What makes several peoples lives’ uncomfortable is that those who sit up in a VP or a “Chief” level position have little to no care about our daily life in the clinic (or at least it feels this way) and they are making decisions left and right without consulting us or asking our thoughts. It seems the Admin leaders would rather lecture me and others about what’s on their mind and what we should do, rather than ask us...what’s working or how can we help. We need to be ask how can we help before being given more work... we simply cannot add more to our full plate!

While Admin leaders talk a big game of inclusivity, transparency, and trust of people across HealthPoint ... I have yet to see any of these traits from the Executive Leadership Team, and very few of these traits are demonstrated at the VP or Director level. Truly, Leadership is sorely needed at the Director level and about and must start from the top down.

review_title: Benefits of Comunity health care and working with a team , excellent career choice.
pros: Excellent Benefits, Ability to grow in the company. The mission of the company, and the wonderful services we provided.
cons: I prefered the 8 hour /5day versus the 10hour 4/day

cons: Managers don't care about the employee's, always loading extra work on everyone, lots of favoritism, high turn overs, staff is rude to each other and lots of gossip.

cons: Sometimes workload is overwhelming. Requires a lot of information retention.
